title: Does Pyke have a ghost crew?
body: In his splash art he's surrounded by other pirate lads underwater, and dialogue conveys him as a leader of a crew, but his lore from memory is very unclear on these matters. Surely he isn't a captain what with his hate for them? Hell, the Swimming City he mentions frequently has zero relevance in his lore too unless it's just a turn of phrase - the LOL equivalent of sleeping with the fishes.

replies.body:
The Swimming City is the key to understanding what happened to Pyke. 
Pyke does not have a crew. 
He does respect the notion of crews and the bonds that make a ship function. 
He is in no way a leader or a captain.

> [{quoted}](name=FauxSchizzle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RpeNEUfT,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-12T21:40:52.909+0000)
>
> The Swimming City is the key to understanding what happened to Pyke. 
> Pyke does not have a crew. 
> He does respect the notion of crews and the bonds that make a ship function. 
> He is in no way a leader or a captain.

Thanks for the clarification. I wonder if the Swimming City will get further development further down the line?
That's not a crew he has in his splash. That's a bunch of living people tied up in a water filled dining room on a ship. He's in the process of murdering several people at once in his splash.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RpeNEUfT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-10-12T18:23:07.090+0000)
>
> That's not a crew he has in his splash. That's a bunch of living people tied up in a water filled dining room on a ship. He's in the process of murdering several people at once in his splash.

Well, that explains their expressions. It looked to me like he had his list out on the table and he was showing it to them, but on closer inspection they're tied down by ropes rather than work commitments :P
The Swimming City is real. It's not affiliated with anything mentioned in the lore though- its completely new

> [{quoted}](name=OurLestrade,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RpeNEUfT,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-10-12T18:21:17.226+0000)
>
> In his splash art he&#039;s surrounded by other pirate lads underwater, and dialogue conveys him as a leader of a crew, but his lore from memory is very unclear on these matters. Surely he isn&#039;t a captain what with his hate for them? Hell, the Swimming City he mentions frequently has zero relevance in his lore too unless it&#039;s just a turn of phrase - the LOL equivalent of sleeping with the fishes.

Good question dude..
